record.title: . About [ Project background, Historical context, Project aims, Project timeline, Fieldwork locations, Sources]
record.detail: This page contains a summary of the project aims, theory, methods and results
Please populate this page with information about the project.
Research project, project description, overview, summary, aims, methods, theory, methodology, results

record.title: . Contacts
record.detail: Use this page to provide contact and location information for the project.

record.title: . Contribute [ Information submission, Volunteer, Employment, Fieldwork]
record.detail:
Use this page to describe ways for the public / other researchers to participate in or contribute to the project.

This could include contact details, descrioption of ways of participating, a request to email information in a specific format, or a direct data entry form (probably as a link or sub-menu).

record.title: . Directors
record.detail: The directors and management staff of the project
Populate this page with the content of the page describing Directors of the project.

record.title: . Discover (search)
record.detail: Search functions to search and display contents of the database represented by/in this website

Remove thse instructions, or replace them with your instructions for users.

This page is set up as a container for database searches. We suggest using

s (or a table) to position the widgets:
search, results list and visualisation (map, timeline, network diagram, report etc.).

 

Click on [Edit page content] in the website editor, then the edit link to set the list of saved searches you want to display on the left,
and to set the parameters of each of the components eg. map in the middle and list of results on the right.

record.title: . Employment
record.detail: Use this page to describe any positions available with the project.

record.title: . Events
record.detail: Use this page to list any events such as seminars, exhibitions, public meetings, consultations etc. organised by the project.

record.title: . FAQ
record.detail: Populate this page with frequently asked questions and responses.

record.title: . Fieldwork locations
record.detail: Locations / sites where fieldwork took place as part of this project
Use this page to map and/or describe any fieldwork/fieldwork locations for the project.

record.title: . Fieldwork
record.detail: Use this page to describe any fieldwork opportunities available.

record.title: . Gallery
record.detail: A page of outputs from the project - images, videos and other visual project outputs
This page could contain a gallery of images, videos or otherproject outputs.

record.title: . Historical context
record.detail: Use this page to describe the historical context or intellectual context of the project.

record.title: . How to ... [ FAQ, Searching, Mapping]
record.detail:
Use this page to provide instructions on how to use the database searches, maps,

timelines or network visualisations, or other interactive resources displayed on the website.

record.title: . Information submission
record.detail:
Add a Heurist data submission form to this page, either directly into the database (but set not to generate public output until reviewed)

or into a separate database wher it can be reviewed and later imported into the main database.

record.title: . Mapping
record.detail: Use this page to describe more advanced uses of the mapping pages.

record.title: . News & Blogs
record.detail: Use this page for specific news about the project (might also connect to blog entries).

record.title: . News and events [ Newsletters, Events, Of interest, Press, News & Blogs]
record.detail: Use this page to outline sources of news about the project, the types of events organised, newsletters, blogs and other public information sources.

record.title: . Newsletters
record.detail:
Use this page to list newsletters if the project produces them. If numerous it may be worth recording them

in the database (including a PDF) and embedding a custom report here to list them, with links to the PDF.

record.title: . Of interest
record.detail: Use this page to connect to third party events which may be of interest.

record.title: . Other resources
record.detail:
Use this page to list and/or describe any other resources developed by the project.

For a list it may be appropriate to embed a Heurist custom report which populates the list from the database.

record.title: . Partner 1
record.detail:
A specific web page devoted to a project partner.

Duplicate fo additional partners.

record.title: . Partner 2
record.detail:
A specific web page devoted to a project partner.

Duplicate for additional partners.

record.title: . Partners [ Partner 1, Partner 2]
record.detail: Acknowledgement and description of project partners (individuals and/or institutions)
Use this page to describe the project partners, including logos where appropriate.

record.title: . Press
record.detail: Use this page to summarise and connect to mentions of the project in the press or other public listings.

record.title: . Project aims
record.detail: Use this page to describe the aims and intended outcomes of the project.

record.title: . Project background
record.detail: Use this page for a description of the background of the project itself.

record.title: . Project outputs [ Gallery, Publications, Tools, Methods, Teaching resources, Other resources]
record.detail:
A page to describe the outputs of the project - may include publications, methods, tools, public websites, community resources etc.

For larger or more complex projects this page will be an overview and different types of output will probably be represented by subsidiary menu entries/pages.

record.title: . Project Team [ Directors, Staff, Volunteers]
record.detail: A page about members of the team involved in the project.

Use this page for photos and descriptions of your project team.

Additional menu entries can link to pages describing different sets of people, eg. Directors, Staff, Volunteers.
Research team, People, Database, Heurist, Humanities, Digital Humanities,

record.title: . Project timeline
record.detail: Use this page to describe the timeline and intended outcomes of the project.

record.title: . Publications
record.detail:
This page may be used to list published outputs of the project.

These could be entered as content here, or could be listed through a Heurist custom report drawing data from the database.

record.title: . Searching
record.detail:
Use this page to provide detailed instructions on the use of the database search functions, including advanced syntax,

preferably with examples of how to construct a search (particularly if you provide a simple search box which can use

all of Heurist's search capabilities and therefore requires a knowledge of the available syntax).

record.title: . Sources
record.detail: Use this page to reference the sources of information used by the project eg. archives, museums, newspapers, online sources.

record.title: . Staff
record.detail: This page contains information about the staff of the project including academics, research assistants, technicians and other persons employed by the project (potentially including unpaid participants who have an intellectual input rather than purely a volunteering role)
Enter description of the staff of the project on this page.

record.title: . Teaching resources
record.detail:
Use this page to list and/or describe any teaching resources developed by the project.

For a list it may be appropriate to use a Heurist custom report and draw the list from the database.

record.title: . Tools
record.detail: Use this page to describe tools developed by the project.

record.title: . Volunteer
record.detail: Use this page to describe opportunities for volunteering with the project.

record.title: . Volunteers
record.detail: Volunteers and interns and members of the public who are participating or have participated in this project.
Enter the list of project volunteers and interns on this page.
Volunteers, Interns, Public participation, Community, Crowdsourcing

record.title: HOMEPAGE: Website name here [ Menus: About, Discover (search), News and events, Project Team, Partners, Contribute, Project outputs, How to ..., Contacts ]
record.detail:
Enter a concise description of the Heurist database / website here, which will be used eg. in lists of websites and in search engine discovery.
Remember to indicate the institution and/or project, target audience and nature of the content.

This is default content generated by the Heurist CMS function. Please edit the web pages in this site to create appropriate content.

The pages may embed images and dynamic components such as facet searches, maps, network diagrams and reports using buttons at the end of the toolbar (when viewed in the website editor).

Please see Heurist CMS instructions for further information.

 

If you come across this page with default content (these instructions), please email the website owner

(link at top right) and ask them to update or delete the page.

 

 

About Heurist

Heurist (HeuristNetwork.org) is a free, flexible, open-source data management application developed specifically for researchers in the Humanities.

Heurist allows researchers to design, build, analyse, visualise, publish and archive their own databases without coding or technical support.

Heurist is available as free, non-commercial web services available to researchers worldwide. Please visit the website to find a service in your region.

Heurist has been developed at the University of Sydney, Australia since 2005 in collaboration with dozens of research projects. The source is available on gitHub.
Digital Humanities, Heurist, Research, Database, Open Data
